p: In this study vulnerability is considered the degree to which a system is susceptible to, or unable to cope with adverse effects of climate change, including climate variability and extremes. A few scientific articles and many reports from financial and regional institutions document the vulnerability of SIDS with respect to climate variability or change at a national level. Some of these investigations are summarized in Table 2 and Fig 2 and provide broad guidance for the Caribbean vulnerability index developed for this study.
